description: Dashing through the snow, in a one horse open slay! The comics adaption of the hit television show continues as the Yuletide rolls into Sunnydale. A puzzling heat wave is the least of Buffy's concerns when she realizes she does not possess the monetary means to afford the holiday season (or a new dress for the Winter Dance!). To add insult to injury, she is forced to get a job in the mall to pay for her expenditures. All would be well, though, if she didn't have to wear a paper hat and if her employer wasn't quite so "cold" toward her . . . Hector Gomez, artist of October's Buffy: The Dust Waltz graphic novel, steps in for this special fill in!
name: White Christmas

description: Soames killed his doctor and left the facility in which he had been kept. Huntress showed up in Bludhaven and wiped up some union guys. Nightwing investigated a double homicide as Huntress tracked a man named Fremunda.
name: Angle of Attack

description:
When the House of Waynesmoor is exiled by King Arthur himself out fo fear for the prophesies of Morgana LeFay, Morgana herself sees her own destruction in young Bruce Waynesmoor!

She is right to be afraid...
name: Batman: Dark Knight of the Round Table Book One of Two

volume.name: Batman: Dark Knight of the Round Table

description: Ben, Sue, and Johnny find themselves in a rescue mission in Genosha, trying to extricate Reed, in the midst of civil war. Following the events of the previous issue, they have to adjust to their new bodies first. While Reed Richards realises what he had feared for a while, he has been operating with diminished intellect since a previous battle with Crucible. While he retains a perfect memory, and can recreate anything he has built before, he is unable to construct anything new. Meanwhile, they must face Crucible one more time. Can Mr Fantastic figure a way out?
name: Once more, o green & pleasant land

description: Spider-Man's origin is reimagined! Peter Parker develops the strength and agility of a spider when an experiment conducted by Doctor Octavius goes awry in "Bitter Lesson."
name: Bitter Lesson

volume.name: Corto Maltese: Ballad of the Salt Sea
Corto Maltese: Ballad of the Salt Sea

description:
General Notes

The world seen in Mark Millar's story was originally seen in Doom Patrol #53. However, while Grant Morrison -former comic writing mentor to Millar- wrote his Doom Patrol story as a parody of Marvel characters (specifically the Fantastic Four), Mark parodied DC characters (specifically the Teen Titans)
name: A Thousand Deaths of Timothy Hunter

description: A being of living lightning plunges all of Metropolis into a world of darkness! With the power out, how can Lois—and the Daily Planet's replacement, Lexcom—stay in business? And how will Superman and the Metropolis Special Crimes Unit,led by Maggie Sawyer—keep the city from falling apart in the darkness?
name: A City Goes Dark!

description:
Batman prepares to invade Titan's island to free the Titans much to Orion's anger feeling he is placing the whole world in danger to rescue children. While Changeling continues on his explanation of why Cyborg has taken these actions, as the Titans begin freeing all of the other captive Titans. While above the Manhunter links with Flash's mind, as Superman destroys the force field imprisoning them below. While Dick still in his pod continues going through the other Titans paradise to free them as they all come out.

Orion and Barda then attempt to destroy the power source despite Changeling's pleas it would destroy Vic's soul. Superman then declares that Vic is little more then a program, as Flash sides with his Titan's teammates to prevent the destruction of Cyborg's soul. Risk then begins the battle attacking and being knocked far away by Orion as Tempest blasts Aquaman launching the two teams into battle. While the battle continues Nightwing continues to try to reason with Batman, as Cyborg sends pods out collecting former allies of the Titans to aid in their battle. Batman then agrees to give Nightwing a chance to reach Vic, having the battle continue as a team of Titans and team from the JLA go to the moon.
name: The Generation Gap

description:
Contains two stories:

"1939" -- Superman and Batman first encounter each other at the Metropolis World's Fair to deal with a rampaging robot under the control of the Ultra-Humanite.

"1949" -- Superman and Batman team together to deal with Lex Luthor and the Joker, who have captured Lois Lane in order to draw out Superman.

Back Cover Blurb:

1939: On the eve of the Metropolis World's Fair, two young heroes meet for the first time: Superman, champion of justice, and the Bat-Man, dark avenger of the night. Together, they must work to defeat the maniacal Ultra-Humanite- no matter what it takes.

1949: Now ten years older and wiser, Superman and Batman face the combined threat of the Joker and Lex Luthor, for the sake of a pregnant Lois Lane- with the aid of Robin, now nearly an adult himself.

A tale of the world's finest heroes and their heirs!
name: The Vigilantes

description:
The destiny of Hunter Rose is a well-known event, and the future of Grendel is an oft-chronicled topic. But what of the people the Devil influenced and intimidated? Matt Wagner, the creator of Mage: The Hero Defined, returns with the talents of Guy Davis (Sandman Mystery Theatre), the Pander Brothers (Secret Broadcast), Stan Shaw (Sunglasses After Dark), Jay Geldhof (The Lost), and Teddy Kristiansen (House of Secrets).

"Devil's Apogee" (Allred) provides a detailed account of Hunter's childhood, from his life in suburbia to the fencing tournament he intentionally lost in the finals, to his time with Jocasta Rose.

"Devil's Curse" (Pander brothers) tells of some criminals marked for death by Rose. They go to a local voodoo priest, Toro, who promises to help. However, when Grendel eventually shows up, Toro's zombies kill the criminals and bring them to hell. Grendel leaves Toro without doing anything to him.

"The Devil's in the Punctuation" (Shaw) is the story of Locutious "Cush" Bradley, the editor of Hunter Rose's novels. Cush actually doesn't do any editing, because Rose won't allow any changes to his work. Cush goes into a downward spiral and eventually leaves the country. This story provides a detailed account of Rose's five novels.

"Devil on My Back" (Kristiansen) is about Grendel's confrontation with a young arsonist who is burning his warehouses. Hunter decides to let him go because he reminds him of himself as a kid, when he also played with the idea of burning everything and everyone.

"Devil's Labyrinth" (Davis) recounts a trap Argent tries to set for Grendel, but Grendel is wise to him. They battle, and Grendel has the upper hand. He ultimately leaves to spend time with Stacy.
name: Bloody Rose

description:
Playing in the confines of the law for once, Jesse begins to properly settle into the role of sheriff of Salvation. However, he quickly learns that Odin Quincannon never backs down, after the Meatman brings in some outside help.

Jesse settles into his job as the new Sheriff of Salvation, and offers to fight for the town - if they'll let him; Quincannon calls in The Klan.
name: Southern Cross

description: Thor and Hercules have arrived on fabled Mount Olympus only to find the home of the Olympian Gods ravaged. But even worse is the news they are met with from Lord Zeus himself. For it was the Asgardians who attacked Olympus. Refusing to believe such heresy, Thor vows to find the true culprits behind the fall of Asgard and Olympus.
name: Deception

description:
One of the most unorthodox crossovers to date, DC's Dark Knight meets Mike Mignola's Hellboy! Ted Knight comes to Gotham City to lecture at a conference on alternative energies sponsored by Wayne Industries. But when Knight is kidnapped by a group of magic-wielding Nazis called the Knights of October, Hellboy offers his aid to Batman to help find Ted and thwart the Knights of October in their plans to marshal the Golden Age Starman's knowledge for their own nefarious purposes. As the heroes track the kidnappers--and their victim--to the Amazon jungle, they'll need some additional help: from Ted Knight's son Jack, Starman.

Golden Age Starman, Ted Night, is lecturing at an alternative energy conference and comes under attack by powered up Neo-Nazi's. The conference is associated with Wayne Industries and Batman is on hand, but he's unable to keep the Nazi's from kidnapping Ted Knight.

Hellboy contact Batman via Jim Gordon. The description of the Neo-Nazi's matches that of a group B.P.R.D. has been investigating. Hellboy thinks that working together may be useful in finding Ted Knight and stopping whatever the Neo-Nazi's have planned.

They track the group to an abandoned airfield outside Gothamand charge in to rescue Ted Knight. The Nazi's have numbers enough to slow them down and spirit Ted Knight off to South America. Batman and Hellboy are unable to follow right away due to a catastrophic contingency the Neo-Nazi's have in place. They travel back to Gotham to prepare to fly down to South America.

A situation involving the Joker requiring Batman's attention prevents him from getting on the plane but the arrival of Starman, concerned for his father's welfare, ensures that Hellboy will not be facing the Neo-Nazi's on his own.
name: Gotham Grey Evil

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
While the battle rages between Aquaman and Noble, they discover a unique bond between themselves.

A surrounded Aquaman is forced to use his allies to make an opening for his retreat, having Mera use her powers to destroy the ships while Tempest and Dolphin attack as Aquaman instructs his shoulders to use hit and run tactics on their far stronger adversaries. While Noble commands his forces to battle to the death, firing a huge energy blast towards a building with a child still present which is out of everyone's reach, however Noble leaps to their aid saving the child's life. But Mera and Noble talk with the language barrier preventing them from making peace as Aquaman sends Noble flying through the use of a whale much to Mera's surprise.

Aquaman and noble then continue their battle with Noble feeling it a cheap trick for Aquaman to resort to using beasts in his battle.Noble then flies into a rage when Aquaman claims to be the king of the seas feeling that title belongs to him as he is far older as Aquaman heads to the palace to gain a replacement hand for his battle.While Tempest continues his battle outside, rushing to save Dolphin's life boiling her attackers blood in retaliation for harming her.While Aquaman forces noble to experience the bends,in the hopes his foe will explode with Aquaman sparing his life in hopes of a compromise with Noble becoming a general for Atlantis and inviting Aquaman and Mera to his city. while the citizens of Atlantis attack Lagoon Boy for his appearance while Garth questions Aquaman's choices and not running them by him.
name: Noble Deeds

description: In this issue the Ultra Marine Corps attacks the JLA in the middle of the city, I call it the city, because it is never named throughout the story, and it does not matter who the people are. The fact that the JLA is trying to get them out of the way while still trying to defend themselves does, and is the one thing that makes the Corps question their orders to kill the League. However, when they do, they come to realize the orders were handed down from the President, and they decide they are soldiers, and can not go against the will of the President. In the mean time, General Eiling is following his own agenda, and Batman is on the case to find out what that agenda is.
name: Scorched Earth

description: All secrets are revealed in the "Son of Man" conclusion, when Little Ronnie unveils his master plan--and shows his true face to a captive John Constantine.
name: Son Of Man, Part 5

description: The battle for the destiny of earth continues. This time it's Captain America's turn to fight the Tiamat. And do you remember that homeless guy who always was cheering Deadpool on? Well it turns out he's a former LL&L director who went underground and has been cultivating Deadpool to be the hero he needs to be to save the world.
name: Dead Reckoning Part 2: 2nd Stringers & Dead Ringers

description: It's a whodunit feudal style as Usagi is caught up in a mystery when he befriends a police inspector investigating the murders of prominent merchants. The clues lead into their past and to a broken trust. Can Usagi and the detective discover the idenity of the next victim before it's too late? Will justice prevail?
name: The Hairpin Murders Part 1

description:
Bruce Wayne goes before Congress to plead for the survival of Gotham City, but there are forces allied against his cause that he cannot even imagine. "Mr. Wayne Goes to Washington" part 2.

Bruce Wayne stands before members of the senate in defense of Gotham. He uses his experiences in his narrative about the determination of the city to survive. However, the board of review points out that the city is a haven for terror and the worst kind of criminals.

Citing the decision by other companies to move out of Gotham, the board of review accuses Bruce of wanting to save his company and his assets. He's also accused of making money off the disaster from taxpayer's money. Before more questions could be asked, he decides to leave the review. Outside, he tells a reporter that he chooses to stay in Gotham because of a promise he made.
name: Mr. Wayne Goes To Washington, Part 2: The Witness

description: When an error in judgment finds an inexperienced Dark Knight wounded and fighting for life in the unfamiliar streets of Chicago, his only hope of survival may be the strange denizens of the city's darkest slums.
name: Playground

volume.name: Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight

description: Robin is still reeling from the murder of his friend Philmont and pursues the two bullies Stanz and Meachum as the main suspects. Meanwhile, Robin adopts an alter ego Alvin Draper so that he can take Stephanie Brown to breathing classes.
name: The Ugly Truth

description: Presenting Turning Points: a month where the MC2 heroes face critical moments which will define their futures! It¹s a major moment in the history of A-NEXT when Thunderstrike, Stinger and J2 discover that Mainframe is already auditioning possible additions or replacements for the team! The first candidates: American Dream and her Dream Team ‹ Freebooter, Crimson Curse and Bluestreak! And, as if that wasn¹t bad enough, the new Avengers are asked to protect a visiting Wakandan Prince ‹ T¹Chaka, the son of the legendary Black Panther! Unfortunately, the Soldiers of the Serpent plan to assassinate him on national television! And, to further complicate the situation, T¹Chaka¹s guardian just happens to be Vibraxas (a former member of the Fantastic Force) ‹ and the prince himself has a dual identity of his own as the mighty Coal Tiger! Plus: cameos by S.H.I.E.L.D. and Jubilee!
name: Who Shall Be Worthy?

description: A simply janitor could be as deadly as the most expert villain...
name: Deadly Is The Dragon King

description:
[Note: This story arc continues from X-Men #82 - The Hunt For Xavier! Part Two: Charley]

An object splashes down into the San Francisco Bay, and soon, the Cerebro unit designated Cerebrite Beta rises onto the shore, intent on locating Professor Charles Xavier. Xavier is currently in hiding within the former prison on Alcatraz Island, along with the Toad and other members of the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants.

Also searching for the Professor are the X-Men, Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Shadowcat and Marrow, who have set down their aircraft in Golden Gate Park. Nightcrawler cloaks the jet, and, with Wolverine tracking Xavier’s scent, they continue their quest in Berkley. They come to a condemned building, which Shadowcat phases into. Inside, she finds the mangled remains of the Professor’s wheelchair. After that, Wolverine continues to trace the scent, which dead ends at the shore. He then mentions a local contact who can help them pick up the trail again.

Meanwhile, in a top secret holding facility in Utah, Cerebro Prime stealthily sneaks in and back out, taking with it a secured sample of Bastion’s nanotechnology.

In Chinatown, Wolverine leads his team to the pharmacy of Black Crane, his clairvoyant acquaintance. Black Crane tells them he ‘sees’ Xavier and the Toad on Alcatraz, but also to beware of another who poses a serious threat.

The team sneaks into the former prison, but are immediately set upon by the Toad, the Blob, the Mimic and Post. As they battle, the Brotherhood exhibit new fighting tactics that seem familiar to the X-Men, as they are similar to those taught to them by the Professor. Acting on that hunch, Shadowcat and Marrow dodge the scrap, quickly finding Xavier in a nearby cell.

As Xavier tries to explain that, at least temporarily, the Brotherhood has allied with him, a wall caves in and Cerebrite Beta makes its entrance.

[Note: This story arc continues in X-Men #83 - The Hunt for Xavier! Part Four: Tomb of Ice]
name: The Hunt For Xavier! Part Three: When You're Unwanted

description: Is it a coincidence that humans have met Aliens in our far future? Or is there something sinister unfolding in the universe that prefigures the Aliens on an almost unfathomable scale? This is what Alecto Throop is asking. Throop is a deep-space rescue specialist cut from the same cloth as the late Lt. Ellen Ripley: tough, smart, beautiful and instinctual. But her instincts weren't enough to warn her of her latest mission. She's about to find out that even a fight with deadly Aliens is nothing compared to meeting their masters . . . or the renegade human that has learned their secrets.

Krill Stromer is captured, and now Senator Malcolm Kenneally has extracted the final equation necessary to complete his XB-023. While the nascent Storm Force 10, allied with the technological might of the mysterious Nishakawa Corporation, rushes to her rescue, Krill learns more of her ancient heritage as she fights for her life against a mutated creature. Our high adventure on the high seas begins building to a shattering crescendo!

The explosive finale of "Tommy's Heroes!" Tommy and his crew bring out the big guns and take the fight directly to Kijaro! But with Scarlet Rose and Skull standing in the way, even the big guns might not be big enough!

Tommy's attempt to do some good has gone completely to hell. He's now stuck deep in the middle of an African country, it's rulers a team of slaughter-happy psychopaths. But what are Tommy and his friends going to have to do to make things right? Are they even any better then those they are fighting?
name: The End of Tommy's Heroes

deck: Supergirl's fight with the Female Furies leads her to Apokolips. Part 2 of 3.
description: After a fight, the Furies capture Twilight and take her to Apokolips; Supergirl follows, using her shunt power.
name: Hell Hath No Furies

description:
Zane delves deep into his subconscious to uncover his fears about his father Juggernaut. But the psychotherapy goes a little too far when J2 must confront Juggernaut in the flesh! Will this father-son reunion have a happy ending? Introducing Slippery Sam!

Zane is talking to Doc Magus and his friend Deacon about his nightmares who involved his father, the Juggernaut. Doc Magus decided to investigate and magically enter in this nightmare but suddenly, the sorcerer is attacked and his real body could died if his spiritual soul is destroyed in the nightmare world.

Zane, awake, offers the help of his alter-ego, J2 and Deacon sends him too to the nightmare world. The juggernaut's son clears Doc Magus of an horde of Darklings just before their master appears: Nemesus.

The battle between the two sorcerer begins and J2 is attacked by his own father. Doc Magus resists to his best against Nemesus but J2 refused to hurt his father. He tries to convince his opponent to stop the fight but the Juggernaut hits him harder. He also tells him that he doesn't be proud of him and that his mother is a miserable woman.

Zane could'nt accepted that and counter-attack with all his rage and anger until he shatters his helmet and discovers ... a darkling. His father is a false. Doc Magus wins too against his opponent who flies. The two heroes only have to run before Nemesus come back with a army of Darkling.

However, J2 doesn't understand more his nightmares about his father. But Doc Magus tells him that, even if this trick didn't work, they could try a lot of other ways to find his father.

Back-up story: In a supermarket with his mother, J2 fights against a man who couldn't be tag by anyone. Slippery Sam ttricks and laughts at him until J2 breaks a fountain. The water throws the villain in front of J2's fist who defeat him in a punch. The young hero just has to join back his mother after this good win.
name: Father Hunt

description: Green Arrow's former sidekick has sided with the JLA's greatest foe because only he can save Roy's daughter. It's a battle that the Titan seemingly can't win as he must assist Vandal Savage in escaping from the police. But can he make it in time to save Lian?
name: Six Degrees, Part 4 - Imprinting

description: While Kyle is off on his quest in space, Jade has taken his place as the Green Lantern of Earth. On her first mission as GL Jade must team-up with Wonder Woman to defeat a threat from the past.
name: Our Mothers' Names

description: Ragged Robin is sent back to the future on her mission to save the world. Half-dead, it doesn't look like she'll have much hope, but King Mob promises he'll meet her there in this touching, romantic story.
name: All Tomorrow's Parties
The Last Molly Story

description:
The Heroes for Hire finish their business in Madripoor, but surprising news awaits their return to New York City!

After an explosion had rocked their boat, the Heroes for Hire team have fallen into the shark-infested waters of the South China Sea, off the coast of Madripoor. Iron Fist kills a shark to distract the rest of the school, allowing him and Shang-Chi to climb aboard some flotsam where they find Colleen Wing and Jessica Drew. Missing is Shen Kuei, the Cat. Suddenly, a submarine rises from the sea and a team of pirates, led by Lionmane, captures the group.

Meanwhile, in the New York headquarters of Oracle, Inc., Namor arrives and informs Jim Hammond that he has sold the organization, putting the future of Heroes for Hire into question.

Hours after their capture, the sub docks in the pirates' lair, a structure Iron Fist guesses is a Chinese government installation. He also guesses Lionmane is General Lo Chien, a fact Lionmane confirms to his captives. Furthermore, Fist's teammate, Shen Kuei, the Cat, reveals himself as an associate of Chien's and a traitor to the Heroes. Unknown to all, Wolverine has sneaked into the base.

Shortly, Lo Chien holds court with his captives, explaining his plan to invade Madripoor and to set himself up as a warlord. At this, Iron Fist focuses his chi and breaks his bonds as well as his allies'. Chien orders his pirates, Cat and his other associate, Sai, to recapture or kill the Heroes as an alarm set off by Wolverine sounds.

After a furious battle, Colleen Wing bests Sai, Fist overwhelms Cat, and then assists Wolverine in defeating Lo Chien.

Upon returning to New York and Oracle's offices, the Heroes learn that the business has been sold to Stark-Fujisawa. Stark-Fujikawa's representative offers positions to some of the Heroes, but not all. Unanimously, the Heroes choose to quit, but maintain their friendships.
name: Sold Out!

description: Foggy Nelson has been arrested for rape and murder one, and his mother refuses to help him, causing Matt to quit. While trying to cool his head, Daredevil stops a mugging, but it turns out to be a trap and he was knocked unconcious. Back at Matt's apartment the man from Matt's office is talking to Karen, telling her that she is HIV positive because misfortune follows the child Matt was taking care of and will continue to do so. Daredevil wakes up in an empty room and hears a sound which pains him. Then a man with a demonic apperance comes in and begins telling him things. Not caring what he has to say Daredevil, breaks out and runs out in the middle of the street with a truck heading towards him.
name: Guardian Devil Part 3: Dystopia

description: Mitch continues his never-ending battle in the delusional world that the villain Skism has created for him. He must face his rogues gallery of Fancy Pants, Needlepoint, the Double Body, and the Angel of Death, and, in this realm of the mind, death will not provide Mitch with his usual way out.
name: Cape Fear, Episode 2. Truth or Dare

description: Part 1 of the 4-part "The Monkey Quartet." A lovestruck Anna Schwarz explores steamy new territories with her boyfriend, while her meddling alter ego, the Minx, quietly crafts a different, disastrous agenda for young Anna. Meanwhile, millennial monkey madness sweeps the globe as the space capsule plummets to Earth. But if the MonkeyGod survives, will the human race be able to stomach the truth?

This New Year's Eve is going to be one to remember for the town of Sunnydale. When a cursed Puritan rolls into town, looking to break a hex placed on him centuries before, trouble follows: in the form of a giant Hellhound! Mania and mayhem ensue! Continue the adventures of the hit television show every month from Dark Horse Comics.
name: Happy New Year

description:
In Japan, the Martian Manhunter must adapt to fight a giant alien robot.

In Japan, while assuming the identity of the manga "legend" Jade Warrior, J'onn battles the colossal robot Antares.
name: Bio Armor Jade Warrior!

description: Bludhaven PD all pondered a message found on a body - "Tattarattat." After Nightwing questioned some bar patrons, they were shot up and another note was left - "Reb Milton's not limber." Huntress, still in Bludhaven, was captured. Soames, calling himself Torque, busted in on Cisco Blaine and his captive, the Huntress. Torque was the killer.
name: Live Not on Evil

description: Bruce Waynesmoor is the Knight of the Bat, chosen by Merlin himself to protect Camelot! But can even he resist the charms of Talia, duaghter of the one men call "The Demon's Head"?
name: Batman: Dark Knight of the Round Table Book Two of Two

volume.name: Batman: Dark Knight of the Round Table

description: More than the scenery is strange when Batman and Batgirl go to Paris on the trail of the League of Assassins. In the shadow of Notre Dame Cathedral, they clash with a dark and grotesque gargoyle-like creature. Is he friend or foe? Will he be Paris' savior or its destroyer?
name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame!

description:
This story arc continues from X-Men #83 - The Hunt for Xavier! Part Four: Tomb of Ice.

Within his Florida facility, Cerebro Prime proceeds with his plans to 'catalog' all mutants, and, most significantly, capture Professor Charles Xavier. However, he receives a notification that his base has been detected by human air surveillance, so Cerebro uploads all his data to his mobile unit, and then initiates a destruct sequence. He also discorporates his surrogate X-Men, stored in stasis tubes, minutes before the facility explodes behind his escape jet.

Within the prison on Alcatraz Island, the X-Men (Wolverine, Nightcrawler, Shadowcat and Marrow) and the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants (the Blob, the Toad, the Mimic and Post) unite to protect Professor X from Cerebro's proxy unit, designated Cerebrite Beta. Wolverine severs its arm, but it pins him under its foot. As it regenerates its hand, Shadowcat tries to tend to Xavier who was partly caught in the collapse of the wall through which Cerebrite Beta burst, but Post, claiming some right to the Professor, warns her to leave him to the Brotherhood's care.

As the battle proceeds, Cerebrite Beta 'catalogs' the Toad, who disappears, apparently disintegrated. Nightcrawler allows Mimic to borrow his teleportation ability and together they shift the construct to a lower level. Nightcrawler makes it back, and with the Cerebrite gone, Shadowcat phases herself, Xavier and Marrow through the floor in an attempt to escape the renewed attention of Blob and Post.

Cerebrite Beta then collapses the floor from below, and all the mutants, save Nightcrawler, fall into the gaping hole. He teleports to the X-Men's jet, which is cloaked and parked in Golden Gate Park, and tries to contact the other X-Men, unaware that they, too, are currently in combat against Cerebrite Alpha, another of Cerebro's agents.

As Cerebrite Beta re-engages the other mutants, Shadowcat tries to lead Xavier and Marrow out of the prison, but inadvertently re-enters the battlezone. Marrow confronts the construct to provide a distraction and Shadowcat and Xavier make good their opportunity to escape again. The Cerebrite follows, with the mutants chasing after it, but it finds Shadowcat and Professor X. As Wolverine catches up, he witnesses the Cerebrite 'catalog' her, and, thinking her dead, he goes berserk, decapitating his opponent.

Mimic explains to the X-Men that the entity is an agent of Cerebro, which had been Xavier's mutant locating computer until Bastion's meddling resulted in the system's gaining self-awareness. He then attempts to fly away with the Professor, but the Cerebrite, having reconstructed itself, 'catalogs' Mimic. Wolverine rushes to his fallen mentor, who tells his students he still feels Shadowcat's mind, meaning she's not dead, but rather, has been somehow moved to Cerebro. He concludes the best way to get to her is to allow themselves to be 'cataloged' as well.

At that moment, Nightcrawler, piloting the jet, arrives above the prison in time to witness Xavier, Wolverine and Marrow vanish in a flash of light emanating from Cerebrite Beta. With no other option, he sets a course for Tajikinistan in hopes of finding the rest of the X-Men.

This story arc concludes in X-Men #84 - The Hunt for Xavier: The Conclusion! Dream's End
name: The Hunt For Xavier! Part Five: Escape From Alcatraz

description: Daredevil is saved from being run over by Black Widow who is still taking care of the baby. However, Daredevil is confused and still believes the baby is evil, so he grabs it and throws himself off the building. He is not thinking straight and stops his fall and makes his way to the church where his mother is and passes out. When he wakes up he converses with his mother and she helps deal with his crisis of faith. He then talks to Karen, who tries to convince him to let her take care of the baby, but he remembers that he never told her about the baby and realizes the organization has gotten to her. When she tries to convince him that the baby is evil and it is responsible for her problems, Matt says it's not the baby's fault, but hers, and she leaves in tears. Then we flash to Bullseye accepting a deal to find the baby and cause as much damage where it is found and whoever was hiding it.
name: Guardian Devil Part 4: The Devils Distaff

description: In the aftermath of his confrontation with Stryfe, Nate heads to England for some much needed R&R. However, his vacation is cut short when he finds himself confronted by the Crusader, a holy warrior that has actually stood toe-to-toe with the Mighty Thor!
name: The Blood of the Righteous

description:
Superman leads a strike team of several of the worlds strongest heroes as they split up to reclaim the Watchtower and begin dismantling the tech covering the moon.While Nightwing,Tempest,Donna, Arsenal and Changeling are teleported in by Raven to reach Vic's soul before their thirty minuter deadline is reached.While across Earth the remaining members of the Titans and JLA struggle with the volcanoes sprouting up across the planet as Steel works on the Titan's computer to receive Cyborg's soul. While Lantern and Wonder 
Woman use his ring energies and the material of her plane to make a net as the heroes move the moon to prevent it from being pulled from it's orbit.
 
 While in the Watch Tower Guy Garnder attempts to distract the drones as Barda,Mr. Miracle, Orion and the Atom attempt to cause the New Genesis tech to repel from the Moon. While the Titans each talk to a manifestation of Vic, letting him know they are still his friends, as Changling uses tough love in an effort to reach him.Beast Boy then uses Cyborg's desires to pacify the Titans to have Vic's father Silas appear which has the moon regain it's proper orbit. Vic then downloads himself into the Titans CPU as the Titans still on the moon drawing the Titans toward space as the JLA and their allies are forced to keep the debris from being drawn into the Earth's atmosphere,while back on the island the CPU unable to hold Vic's soul prepares to explode as Raven draws him in while Steel is forced to find an alternative shell. 
 
While the JLA continue to stop the debris from impacting around the world, the atom sets out to use the New Genesis technology to magnetically draw the falling debris back to the moon. The abandoned Titans meanwhile are forced to come up with a plan to return to Earth before running out of air, with Nightwing suggesting having the Omega-Drome shapeshift into a ship.However the plan fails, but fortunately Omen arrives with Changling suggesting she take the Omega-Drome to hold Victor's essence but this forces her to leave behind Dick,Donna,Garth,Roy and Wally. Gar then has Raven funnel his soul into the Omega-Drome, with Cyborg taking on a humanoid shape. The remaining Titans in space then begin saying there to each other with the hull coming apart, when they are saved by the Green Lantern. The meteor shower then ends, as it's revealed Magenta used her powers to draw them all back from the Earth's atmosphere. After the clean up the various heroes go to Guy Gardner's bar with Aquaman and Tempest rebonding,  Changeling promising to be by Cyborg's side as he gets used to his body, Mirage letting Manhunter hold her baby as an act of good will for assuming his deceased wife's shape in battle,while the various heroines discuss Nightwing's best feature as he reconnects with Starfire,while Captain Marvel forces CM3 to apologize for attacking Superman and Guy unveils a Titan's monument for the founders.
name: All In The Family

description:
Contains two stories:

"1959" -- Superman and Batman deal with Mxyzptlk and Bat-Mite in a contest over whose hero is worthy enough to be taken to a far-off world to fend off an alien invasion.

"1969" -- Superman's family deals with Joel Kent going off to fight the Vietnam War and Lois Lane Kent diagnosed with cancer, while Batman's family solves the mystery of "Joker Junior".
name: Strange Days

description:
According to the Bible, the Devil was an angel cast from Heaven to serve punishment in Hell. Often, New York City can feel like Hell, and the Big Apple has its very own Devil . . . or is he an angel of death? Saving the best for last, Matt Wagner (Mage: The Hero Defined) brings the talents of Jason Pearson (Body Bags), Troy Nixey (Trout), Woodrow Phoenix (Sugar Buzz), Jay Geldhof (The Lost), and Chris Sprouse (Supreme).

In "Devil's Cage" (Pearson), Hunter and Stacy argue over the cartoons she wants to watch. He leaves in anger, and ends up killing some muggers for fun. Stacy takes out her own anger on her stuffed animals, tearing them apart.

"Devil's Witness" (Phoenix) tells the tale of a plant whom Rose sets up to give the police some false information. He feels proud of his acting job and drives off with Larry Stohler, who poisons him.

"Devil's Domain" (Sprouse/Martin) is a series of splash pages of Grendel and Argent, with short poetic texts underneath.

"Devil's Stigma" (Geldhof) shows a vignette of Argent telling Stacy some stories, only to be interrupted by Hunter coming home.

"Devil's Mark" (Nixey) is about an assassin who tries to become friends with his targets before killing them. However, in this case he is himself the target of Grendel.
name: Pool of Blood

description:
Cindy and Jesse confront the recently arrived Ku Klux Klan, and Odin Quincannon gets pushed further and further toward deadly desperation! The fan favorite series by writer Garth Ennis and artist Steve Dillon continues!

Jesse and Cindy take the fight to The Klan; Odin Quincannon realizes it's time to get serious.
name: White Mischief

description: When Thor attempts to return to Asgard he finds his passage mystically blocked. But he does not have long to contemplate this as an agent of the Dark Gods descends upon the helpless mortals under his protection. But even with the Amazing Spider-Man by his side, can the Thunder God prevail against this new foe?
name: . . . And the Home of the Brave!

description:
One of the most unorthodox--and stylish--crossovers to date concludes! Hellboy and Starman venture to a secret Nazi base in the Amazon jungle to rescue Starman's father, Golden Age Starman Ted Knight. Kidnapped by the Nazi cultists, the elder Knight had been forced to use his scientific knowledge of cosmic energy to call down a powerful elder god. Now Starman's science and Hellboy's sorcery must combine to save the world from a threat older than time and more horrible than anything the world has ever known!

Starman and Hellboy travel to South America on a mission to rescue Ted Knight from the hands of a Neo-Nazi group. The Nazi's have plans to use Ted Knights expertise to help them revive a long-dormant Elder God.

When Starman and Hellboy arrive at the Nazi base, the rite to revive the Elder God is already under way. They need race to against time to infiltrate the base, find Ted Knight, disrupt the rite and destroy the Elder God before it reaches strength.
name: Jungle Green Horror

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
While out of the city, Mera is kidnapped by Fire Troll. Aquaman and Aqualad are in hot pursuit!

Aquaman and Mera arrive in Noble's city where Mera grows closer to Noble who reminds her of a younger Aquaman before all of the tragedy that had changed him. While Aquaman in a bid to change the subject questions Noble about the tunnels there city is built on, he reveals they were made by Rockcreatures who live in them Aquaman then desires to explore them which Noble advises against,however he then learns they have stolen more women from the city with Noble refusing to do anything due to the myths of their power. Mera is then taken with Aquaman following despite Noble being afraid to follow but pushed into it at Aquaman's urging.

It's then discovered to be Fire Trolls are the creatures dwelling under the city, with the two racing to save her. While back in Atlantis Garth struggles with his responsibilities as High Councillor. While underground Aquaman rescues a nearly unconscious Mera with her only word being Noble, while Aquaman confronts the Lava Lord a fire troll he created when he dropped one in toxic waste.
name: Same as it Never Was

description:
The book opens with us discovering that General Eiling has transfered his Brain from his cancerous body and into that of the Shaggy Man. Unfortunately, Batman and Huntress, have to face him, with their only powerhouse being Plastic Man.

Back on the streets of the city, the JLA has been taken down except for Superman who lands in front of the army and the Ultramarine Corps. He makes a plea with them just to listen, and to contact General Eiling so they can find out for themselves that he is unfit for command. When they do, the JLA and Ultra Marines attack the general, much to Batmans dismay.
name: Our Army At War

description:
The true nature of the messiah is learned, and Deadpool must kill it. He finally has his chance to be a hero. 
The final showdown with Tiamat begins. He's defeated Captain America and now it's round two with Deadpool.
But it seems theres more to "the messiah" then those at LL&L know. It is learned that it brings bliss to all the planets it's been to, in the process taking away their free will.
Now Deadpool must decide which is more important: happiness or progress.
name: Dead Reckoning Part 3: What the World Needs Now

description: A woman has been murdered. Her killing seems unrelated to the series that Usagi and Inspector Ishida are investigating. A look into her past, however, connects her to the three previous victims, but the evidence points to her as the killer! When higher-level bureaucrats and officials stonewall the investigation, though, questions and suspicions are raised. It's a murder mystery feudal style, in part two of "The Hairpin Murders," as Usagi untangles a hair-raising web of betrayal and deceit that spans a decade.
name: The Hairpin Murders, Part 2

description:
Overview

Gotham City is shut down after pleas for its rehabilitation fail. Now, there is a massive exodus of people but not all are allowed to leave.

With political support, Gotham City is shut down and a citywide evacuation is ordered by the government. People are given 48 hours to leave and massive crowds fill all exits. Anyone with criminal connections are barred from leaving but Killer Croc still makes an attempt.

As Oracle watches the news, Bruce Wayne and Mayor Grange discuss Gotham's fate. Unknown to them, Scratch hired an assassin to eliminate Bruce. However, the mayor is killed instead. A furious Scratch sends his own men to finish the job.

Over at Gotham, at the same time, Commissioner Gordon meets with the coroner after examining one of Scratch's captured men. As bridges are destroyed, people are in a hurry to leave and Oracle decides to stay behind. The criminally insane resent their isolation and make plans of their own.

In Washington, congress prepares to officially declare Gotham "dead" but Bruce Wayne is absent.
name: Mr. Wayne Goes to Washington: 3 The Devil His Due!

description: Many years ago, a tragic accident on the Gotham River resulted in the birth of an aquatic creature dwelling in the caves that connect to those beneath Wayne Manor. Now the creature's obsession with a locket that belonged to Martha Wayne leads to a confrontation with the Batman!
name: The Darkness

volume.name: Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight

description: Robin looks to Nightwing and Oracle for advice on tracking down Philmont's killer. Things become a little more complicated when he spots Stephanie Brown in his school and fears his identity being revealed.
name: The Killer!

description: Doctor Doom appears in the MC2 Universe for the first time - but is he the same man we remember?! In A-NEXT #3, we briefly mentioned a war between Namor and a certain diabolical dictator that left Latveria in ruins. Now we learn a little more about this terrible tragedy as Stinger, along with American Dream and her Dream Team (Freebooter, Crimson Curse and Bluestreak), journey to Latveria to investigate and battle the recently resurrected Doctor Doom! Meanwhile, Thunderstrike and J2 do some male bonding as only the Earth's Mightiest Heroes can! Plus: quick cameos by John Storm, Ben Grimm and S.H.I.E.L.D.
name: The Gift

description:
What is haunting Colossus and what does it have to do with his sister Illyana?

On Christmas Eve, Colossus is visited by the ghost of his sister Illyana.
name: Ghost of X-Mas Past!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: An Alien "angel" has been met, as veil after veil is lifted, and Alecto Throop begins to grasp the enormity of the forces at work behind Dr. Keitel's deception. But, the Aliens may represent only the brink of an unfathomable pit of cosmic horror. Join Throop Rescue and Recovery as they follow the elusive Keitel to a petrified world that was ancient long before life first crawled on Earth. Our universe has never seemed so big. . . so old. . . or so hideously dark.

The end is coming, as Krill Stromer and her StormForce 10 race to the Antarctic Ocean in a last-ditch effort to stop Senator Malcolm Kenneally from loosing the unspeakable horror of the Urschlime on the world. Join the team, as they face their trial by fire, and Krill, as she returns full circle to meet her inescapable destiny, in a nightmarish sea beneath the sea! Batten the hatches! SubHuman concludes its inaugural miniseries in a typhoon of relentless action and adventure!

Who is Wild Thing, and what beef does she have with J2? The daughter of Wolverine pounces and Zane is left entirely unawares! Sachi Yama continues to unravel the mystery of the new Juggernaut, endangering not only herself…but her son too!

J2 is with the A-next team who are receiving the NYC keys. But two persons look a it with insistence: Sashi Yama, his mother who don't know he is and Wild Thing, the daughter of Wolverine and Elektra who want to know more about the guy who appears like a X-Men's former foe.

Zane's mother asks about J2's relationship with the original Juggernaut but Mainframe answers that the information is classified. Mrs Yama doesn't content with this answer and follow J2 in the street after the press conference. Zane, always in J2's form tries to hide in a alley but it was the moment Wild Thing attacks him.

Even if J2 tries to tell Wolverine's daughter that this attack is no sense, the fight goes on. Answering to a mighty strike of Wild Thing, J2 shatters a wall and his mother, watching the scene, is hurt and fall unconscious. Immediately, the young hero takes the woman to the hospital while his opponent flies with remorses.

In the hospital, Zane discovers that his mother believes that it was J2 who initiates the fight. Sadly, he begins to leave the hospital when he sees Wild Thing at the reception desk. The girl is asking about Mrs Yame's condition but Zane believes she is searching after him.

After his transformation in the toilets, he fiercely attacks WIld thing. The fights begins in the hospital and goes on in the street. The two opponents destroy building and cars in the fight. Wild thing tricks J2, simulating his defeat. Afraid of having hurting her, J2 goes near the girl who strike him with his psychic claws. But the hit isn't enought and the fight continues.

Finally, Wolverine appears, asking for his daughter. But, during the small conversation between J2 and the former X-Men, Wild thing disappears. However, J2 is happy to know that jubilée talks to Wolverine about him in a laudatory way.

In the back story, Zane walks to the hospital where his mother is. He discovers the consequences of his battle with Wild Thing. In one part, some people thinks the super-hero are dangerous but he mets children who all want to play the J2's role in their game. So, even if later,leaving the hospital with his mother, she rags against super-heroes and especially J2, the young Zane feels very happy.
name: Wild Thing!

description: Christmas Issue - "Ghost of Christmas Past!" Guest-starring Alan Scott. Jade confronts the ghosts of her past in this special Holiday tale.
name: Ghosts of Christmas Past

description: As the Invisibles crawl through the wreckage caused by Ragged Robin's time-machine voyage, one team member disappears and another decides to quit while the rest of the gang toasts more fabulous and fashionable adventures ahead.
name: The Tower

description: Includes an original Books of Faerie back-up feature entitled "Sturm and the Silver Treasure".
name: The Wager

description: The JLA struggles to contain the destruction that Mitch is causing with his new power as he goes toe-to-toe with the lethal fury of the psychotic, more powerful-than-ever Major Force!
name: Cape Fear, Episode 3. Major League

description: Part 2 of the 4-part "The Monkey Quartet." The MonkeyGod shows his face and reveals the ultimate message--but can the world cope with the hideous truth of what he has become? And while Anna agrees to jet to the UK with Angus McAnguish to meet the MonkeyGod, the Minx has other plans--namely to revisit her birthing ground.

Overview

With spring in the air and a day off from school, the gang decides to have a get together. Harboring thoughts of an all-night, all-girl slumber party, Willow's new gal-pal, Cynthia, volunteers to coordinate it. The only problem is whom to invite. Buffy's in. Cordelia, too. What about Xander? Eight ladies, all in their pajamas. One way or another, Xander's going to make it!

There is a great fight scene in the cemetery in this issue. Angel and Buffy fight side-by-side and it is not an easy fight for Buffy, as the blonde girl gets hit hard twice by a vampires. There is also a nice cliffhanger ending here. While Buffy is searching for some money to give a tip to the pizza delivery man, we see six vampires behind her, eagerly waiting to attack the girl.
name: New Kid on the Block Part 1

description:
The Martian Manhunter's investigation of a mystery at Cadmus leads to Bette Noir.

J'onn investigates a psychic presence within a Cadmus genetic research facility, and his relationship with private detective Karen Smith comes to a dead end.
name: Femme Fatal

description: Cisco and Huntress began working together. The unions were trying to get in on the Gotham rebuilding scene. Nightwing watched as Huntress went in for the score against Fremunda (the union head).
name: Live Not on Evil, Part 2

description:
Ronan, a Kree enforcer, is battling the Fantastic Four and has the Human Torch and Invisible Woman in his clutches. Reed and Ben interfere and save Johnny, but Sue is still in trouble. He unleashes a strange creature that he calls a Mannequinn on her that takes control of her body and makes her his slave.

Meanwhile, Reed rescues an operative wearing an X-Men uniform. She is about to ambush the Kree but Reed knocks her out, knowing an attack would be futile. Johnny is also fighting a Kree and with the help of Ben, knocks it out. At the end, we see Ronan with Sue at the Dome of the Watcher, wanting to break in.
name: The moon is a lonely place to DIE HARD!

description:
Peter Parker has just got his amazing powers as Spiderman. But he is not pleased at all. Facing his recent defeat at the hands of Dr. Octopus, he just wants to quit.

The next day, Peter Parker tells Flash Thompson that spiderman is a coward. This remark hits Thompson right where he lives. Flash is Spiderman's biggest fan. He can't take an insult of his hero lightly. So he gets into a fight with Peter. Peter shoves him but some of his Spider-strength comes into play. Peter is afraid of the consequences of his great strength and leaves quickly. On the way home, he disposes of his glasses because his eye muscles have benifitted from the spider powers.

Meanwhile, J.J. Jameson is watching the tape of Spiderman's defeat against Dr. Octopus with great interest. He tells Robbie that he will take every measure to disgrace Spiderman.

Flash Thompson wants to teach Parker a lesson about insulting Spiderman. He dresses up as Spiderman and hides behind a wall to grab Peter, who is coming around the corner. But a crueler fate awaits him.

Dr. Doom is sitting in his Spaceship when he detects Spiderman's biochemical emenations. He has a visual on Spiderman soon. He renders the ship invisible and grabs Spiderman (Flash Thompson) in a tractor beam. Peter Parker senses danger but cannot make anything out. Peter comes to school and hears that The Fantastic Four have declined an invitation to catch Dr. Octopus but promises to do soon afterwards. He also hears that the Human torch has come to school to have a talk with the students.

Torch voices his true feelings about being a hero. He says that though he had been defeated in the past and come close to quitting, he remembered his responsibility as a hero and stayed in the business. Peter Parker is amazed at the confession and makes up his mind to trash Dr. Octopus.

He rigs up a chemical kit and invades Octopus' den. Octopus detects him soon enough. He tries to kill him with heavy metal parts but Spiderman evades them. He jumps over the arc of the cameras which makes Dr. Octopus come out himself. He attacks spiderman with all his effort. Spiderman manages to break the chemical vials on the tentacles, which fuses them together. But Dr. Octopus holds him against his chest plate. Spiderman punches him in his face and knocks him out. He trusses him up and hands him over to the police.

Later he visits the Baxter building and thanks the Human Torch, saying that it is because of him that Spiderman is still alive. Parker returns home and turns on the tv, only to find that Dr. doom has captured Flash Thompson and threatens to kill him if the Fantastic Four do not surrender. Parker dresses up as Spiderman and goes in search of Dr. Doom.

Meanwhile, the Fantastic Four have also seen the broadcast and move out to find Dr. Doom.

Spiderman gets atop the World Trade Center and tries to use his instincts to find out Doom. He fells something above him and throws webbing into a cloud, only to find that it is a cloak around Dr. Doom's ship. He comes inside the ship and gets caught on an electrified plate. Dr. Doom sits in front of him and tells that Spiderman has only two choices: help Doom defeat the Fantastic Four, or die!

At the Xavier Institute, Kitty Pryde (Shadowcat) is awakened from her sleep when Sarah (Marrow) harasses her by dropping a dead rat onto her bed. The pair verbally spar, until Marrow mentions in passing that she saw terrorists planting bombs in the New York City subway tunnels. Alarmed, Kitty gathers the X-Men in the kitchen to question Marrow. Hearing Marrow's description of the terrorists, Logan (Wolverine) surmises that Flag-Smasher and ULTIMATUM are probably who she saw.

Storm decides the team will investigate, and splits the X-Men into two teams; she, Rogue, Colossus and Gambit will scout the stations, while Marrow, Kitty, Wolverine and Nightcrawler search underground. The latter quartet head into the city on an old garbage sweeper train, using walkie-talkies Marrow had stolen to communicate with the other team.

Reaching the point where Marrow saw the terrorists, the team splits into pairs. Marrow is paired with Nightcrawler, but Kitty insists on accompanying her instead, surprising Marrow, considering their earlier confrontation. They will head down track while Nightcrawler and Wolverine check the other. Marrow, still sporting a chip on her shoulder about humans, continues to taunt Shadowcat about her beauty and being able to fit in with the "fleshbags".

Nightcrawler and Wolverine come upon a troop of ULTIMATUM soldiers and engage in a short fight, during which Wolverine suffers gunshot wounds that he needs time to recover from.

Meanwhile, Colossus and Rogue have split off from the Storm and Gambit. They also encounter an ULTIMATUM squad aboard a train, and the two X-Men easily win the ensuing fight. Shadowcat phases herself and Marrow through the subway walls to reach the train Colossus and Rogue are aboard, winding up in the car where ULTIMATUM is transporting the bomb. However, they are held at gunpoint by the goons. At the same time, Nightcrawler and Wolverine manage to teleport aboard the train, rejoining Colossus and Rogue.

Storm and Gambit locate Shadowcat and Marrow and burst into the car, routing their captors. The others arrive shortly, and the train comes to a stop below the United Nations building. Marrow feels something is wrong with the situation and leaps out of the car, followed by Shadowcat. As they run down the tracks, Marrow tells her the bomb's a fake, since blowing up the UN would be counter to Flag-Smasher's motives. Marrow is sure the real motivator has to do with money, so she leads them to the tunnels beneath Wall Street.

There, they discover Flag-Smasher has another bomb beneath Wall Street, the financial center of New York, the first simply being a decoy. The duo overwhelm him, then Shadowcat turns her attention to the bomb. Having no idea how to defuse it, she is ready to sacrifice her life by phasing the bomb underground, but Marrow instead knocks her unconscious.

She then stabs Flag-Smasher through his shoulder with one of her detachable bones, pinning him to the base of the device, and tells him that he can defuse the bomb or die with it. She carries Shadowcat from the scene, and sets her down along the tracks some distance away. Shadowcat comes to soon after, angry at Marrow for her actions. However, as Marrow had predicted, the bomb doesn’t detonate. The pair are soon found by the rest of the team, and they head back for home. Along the way, Marrow ponders the heroic actions of the X-Men, also softening her feelings toward Kitty.
name: Cat & Mouse

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: When a golden-skinned beauty crashes to earth Nate finds himself caught in the middle of an alien vendetta. But as the mystery unfolds Nate may discover that he fighting on the wrong side of this feud.
name: Skyfall

description:
Contains two stories:

"1979" -- Superman's daughter Kara Kent and Batman's son Bruce Wayne Jr. are prepared to marry, but a past nemesis of Superman plans to ruin more than the day.

"1989" -- Superman is accused of murdering Lex Luthor, and Batman's son intends to find out the truth.
name: Twilight of the Gods

description: The mechanical monstrosity known as Replicus has returned to plague mankind and only the God of Thunder possesses the power to stop him. Plus finally, the mysterious Marnot reveals the truth about the Dark Gods who have conquered fabled Asgard.
name: Answers

description: Daredevil takes the cross he was given to Doctor Strange to see if it has any magical properties or connections, but none are found. However, it did contain a drug that makes one highly susceptible to suggestion and unable to reason logically. They then summon Mephisto to see if there are any signs of the Christian apocalypse. He says there are none and that Daredevil should check on his mother. When he gets back to the church, everybody except his mother is dead. Bullseye then attacks him after making numerous references to J.D Salinger's Catcher in the Rye. Bullseye gets the advantage, but Karen arrives and tries to trade the baby for Daredevil's life. However, the baby is a fake, and so they give him the real one, but before Bullseye leaves, he tosses Daredevil's billy club at him but Karen jumps in the way saving Matt's life at the cost of her own her last words were "I'll miss you".
name: Guardian Devil Part 5: Devil's Despair

description: In this issue, the JLA is tipped off to the whereabouts of the Amazo android, and told they have a limited amount of time before he is online. The Amazo dandroid has the powers of the JLA. Which incarnation does not become clear until he is actually up and running. At that point it becomes a battle royale between one Android, and the entire JLA. Their only hope lies with the smallest of all The Leaguers.
name: The Bigger They Come
